title: How to Make Coconut Flour Pancakes

steps.headline: Whisk together the eggs, oil (2 tablespoons), milk, sugar, and salt in the larger bowl.
Mix together the flour and baking powder in the medium sized bowl.
Mix the wet and dry ingredients together thoroughly.
Melt about a tablespoon of the oil in the skillet.
Spoon, or scoop, the batter onto the skillet making a pancake about 4–5 inches (10.2–12.7 cm) in diameter.
Continue until you have made all of the batter.
Serve with the topping (or toppings) of your choice.

methods.name: Making Khanom Buang or Thai Crispy Pancakes

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients for making the pancake batter together.
steps.description: Mix the rice flour, mung bean flour, sugar, egg, and water together until combined.

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients of the white cream together.
steps.description: Mix the white egg and sugar. Mix to soft peaks.

steps.headline: Open the oven pan Teflon used to light the fire and use a spoon to scoop flour pancake and smear a thin sheets (the size according to need) onto the oven until cooked flour (white).
Add toppings.
steps.description: When the pancake begins to turn brown, put the cream on top. Put the filling you prefer. The filling for this recipe is foi thong, but you can put other fillings if you'd like.

steps.headline: Open up the dough and fold the circle in half when the dough begins to scorch and then frame.
steps.description: Open up a plate from the oven and serve.

text: Cooking Coconut Flour Pancakes Whisk together the eggs, oil (2 tablespoons), milk, sugar, and salt in the larger bowl.  Mix together the flour and baking powder in the medium sized bowl.  Mix the wet and dry ingredients together thoroughly.  Melt about a tablespoon of the oil in the skillet.  Spoon, or scoop, the batter onto the skillet making a pancake about 4–5 inches (10.2–12.7 cm) in diameter.  Continue until you have made all of the batter. Should make about 8 pancakes. Serve with the topping (or toppings) of your choice.  Making Khanom Buang or Thai Crispy Pancakes Mix the ingredients for making the pancake batter together. Mix the rice flour, mung bean flour, sugar, egg, and water together until combined. Mix the ingredients of the white cream together. Mix the white egg and sugar. Mix to soft peaks. Open the oven pan Teflon used to light the fire and use a spoon to scoop flour pancake and smear a thin sheets (the size according to need) onto the oven until cooked flour (white).  Add toppings. When the pancake begins to turn brown, put the cream on top. Put the filling you prefer. The filling for this recipe is foi thong, but you can put other fillings if you'd like. Open up the dough and fold the circle in half when the dough begins to scorch and then frame. Open up a plate from the oven and serve.
